name: The Fullerton Hotel Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after a difficult trip and in desperate need of relaxation and some serious pampering, we have stayed in various hotles in Singapore but the Fullerton is the best so far. Service is exceptional without being too grandious.
reviews.title: fabulous service, luxury accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came back thoroughly refreshed.
reviews.title: An interesting hotel

reviews.text: Stayed in a quay room which was unusal to say the least, very high ceiling with a tiny window. The pool area is very small & can become crowded. Breakfast was excellent as were the staff throughout the hotel. The complimentary birthday cake I recieved was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Beautiful!

reviews.text: First time in Singapore on business - excellent all round.
reviews.title: Not worth it - tiny rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I upgraded to a port view - well worthwhile.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Soft side of this hotel is very good. Service excellent everywhere - from the front desk through the restaurants to housekeeping to the concierge and doormen. Really very good. And its position on the Marina is pleasant - bit downtowny, but really OK.
reviews.title: Disappointing : great service cannot compensate for cramped rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hardware - the room - is just nowhere near where you should be if you are aspiring to five stars and charging SD 410 ++.
reviews.title: Fantastic- make sure you stay there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was tiny with the bed taking up 80% of it. If there are two of you in the rooom, one is going to have to be on the bed. You expect this in older Japanese hotels, but not anywhere else at these rates. Other hotels in Singapore are more spacious and cheaper.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful lobby

reviews.text: As others here have commented, the mattress is hard. If you like hard, fine. Personally I could not sleep. Not helped by airconditioning that struggles to keep up with demand. So warm and humid nights spent on an uncomfortable bed.
reviews.title: Elegant & Efficient

reviews.text: Bathroom is better - about the same size as the room? Has most of what you would expect, but materials and finish just not first class.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We recieved a welcome upgrade which may have biased our view, we had 2 of the largest rooms.The staff were extremely friendly & efficient, breakfast is a buffet of good quality & we tried the seafood buffet which was both great value & great quality, both meals can be taken outside overlooking the river. The location is great for the local bar area & the central business district both on the doorstep, although those wanting to shop may favour an orchard road hotel. The only small negative comments I would have was perhaps the curtains could provide better 'black out' to prevent the early morning sun & the floodlights at night from the casino construction site across the bay(no noise was audible during our stay) plus the pool was a little small & cold(although quite empty during our visit)
reviews.title: one of the best

reviews.text: This is the 2nd time I have stayed at the Fullerton and it will be the last. When I checked in I reminded Reception that I had a 6pm check-out the next day, and please make sure that House-keeping don't keep knocking on my door trying to make up the room, like they did the last time I stayed. Anyway, of course they did it again anyway. Then, when no-one answered their knocks, they slipped a note under my door saying "your laundry is ready for pick-up"!!! I hadn't even submitted any laundry. (the note was supposed to say they wanted to make-up my room).
reviews.title: Worst service ever in a hotel

likes.liked: — It's a great hotel but nothing works properly and the staff are pathetic

reviews.text: When I checked in, the room was freezing so I turned off the air-con. Six hours later, it was still freezing. Having lived in Singapore for the past several years, I did not have any pyjamas with me. I was freezing in bed, so rung up Reception and asked someone to come and fix the air-con. Two men came up and had to enter the ceiling to switch off the valve. This was completed AFTER midnight and by this time I was freezing and absolutely exhausted. I had to sleep with my dressing-gown wrapped around me, socks on my feet, as well as a sheet and doona over the top. (remember, this is Singapore, where even top-sheets are usually not needed)
reviews.title: Luxurious hotel with spacious rooms

likes.disliked: — The building was an old post-office prior to renovation - could be scary for some people!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then, the message light kept blinking on the phone. I rang up to retrieve the message, but there was no message! The operator assured me they would fix the blinking light. This happened 7 times!! Eventually, they said someone would come up to the room........ they didn't turn up! Later, I had to call up and AGAIN ask for someone to come up and replace the phone. Many of the time I had to ring Reception and Concierge, no-one answered the phone. They also screwed up my breakfast order.
reviews.title: Bad start but finished well

reviews.text: So, how did the hotel atone for this? An apology when I checked out....that's it. This is not good enough. I particularly chose the Fullerton, so I'd get a good night sleep before flying red-eye the next night. If you are reading this, Fullerton management, a simple apology upon check-out is not good enough. At the very least, some sort of compensation should be offered, even if it's just paying a small part of the bill. I am going to be angry about this for a long time to come.
reviews.title: Disappointing- not worth the price compared to similiar hotels in Singapore

likes.liked: — the pool is amazing- best in Singapore. The building is beautiful. Location great

reviews.title: well-designed layout, but avoid courtyard room
reviews.text: The good:

likes.disliked: — no sunlight, courtyard music, carpets that felt damp

reviews.text: - nice room design: spacious all-granite bathroom, big desk and good work area, 50% larger than normal rooms

reviews.text: - beautiful fruit basket on arrival - far more than I could eat
reviews.title: Fullerton 'sweet' for baby

reviews.text: - lovely bathtub and shower, though sides of bathtub were so high that it's hard for a short person to get in
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.text: - close to Boat Quay and food market
reviews.title: Perfection
Unsurpassable service
reviews.text: Having been slightly put off the hotel with some mediocre views, it was with a little trepidation that I booked the hotel, having always wanted to stay there due to the amazing setting on the Singapore River.

From start to finish, we were thoroughly impressed. The service was just unbelievable. We were shown round our room by the front of office manager (a quay view room, which was very spacious) and couldn't have had more done for us. Our deal included free bathrobes, a lunch in the Town restaurant (where the buffet was the largest I've ever seen - including a fresh seafood section, sushi, Western food, etc), wine and the hotel even provided us with a complimentary bottle of champagne.
reviews.title: Only just worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was a good size, with electric curtains, lights, huge walk in shower and with a balcony overlooking the river.
reviews.title: Good But At This Price I Need to Mention It's Faults - Esp. Taxis

likes.disliked: — Taking cabs from the hotel was absolutely terrible and the hotel can and should do something about it

reviews.text: The pool was beautiful - with a seated section along one side combining the pool and jacuzzi!
reviews.title: Great location, inside just standard

reviews.text: I can't rate this hotel highly enough, and would definitely go back again in future.
reviews.title: Full Marks to the Fullerton! What a star!

likes.liked: — 1) My room! The bed was ultra comfy, 2) The Pool - the city river view was amazing, 3) The fruit danish at the brekky buffet, 4) The staff
likes.disliked: — If you happen to be outside trying to gain entry at night, enter via the Main foyer on the river side of the building (or like me you had to walk around the entire building as the other exists were locked)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Fullerton a few times over the past year in different room types. There is no doubt the Fullerton is a grand hotel with all the grace and amenities you'd expect from a top notch 5 star international hotel. The staff are formal without being stuffy and everything appears to run very professionally. The hotel also has a superb location right on the Singapore river, in the middle of downtown, with the Boat Quay and Clark Quay strips literally minutes away by foot, and the Colonial District and the Esplanade complex also directly across the river via a small 19th century footbridge. On my most recent visit I tried one of the base grade courtyard rooms for the first time - keep in mind even these base grade rooms can come in at the better part of US$500 a night including breakfast. The room was furnished to the same standard as all the other rooms I've had there and have almost all of the same amenities - but no i-pod docking station for example. As the name suggests these rooms look into the hotel's huge internal glass roofed atrium. I was on the second to top floor of the hotel so very close to the roof and I found this let in plenty of natural light notwithstanding the internal view but I dont know how well this would work if you were on one of the floors nearer the ground floor. What I did notice was that this room grade is smaller than the others and I know you can get much larger rooms in other 5 star hotels in Singapore with an outside view for less. With 2 people and their luggage in the room there is still room to swing a cat - but only just. The other thing I noticed is that in the afternoons there is a pianist playing in the lobby which is great - except that the music is very audible in the room which wasn't great when you have jet lag and want to rest during the day. All up, still a real institution of a hotel but in my opinion the courtyard rooms do not offer good value for money.
reviews.title: A grand hotel but the courtyard rooms are overpriced

reviews.text: I stayed two weeks at the Fullerton for business and give it overall high ranks. First, the location is excellent, in the central business district and a within a block of the subway system. Second, the service is excellent, with prompt responses to all needs. Staff is very friendly. I had a basic entry-level room facing the inside atrium. Its pretty quiet unless there is a reception in the atrium then it can get a bit noisy, but that was for only one of the nights, so really cannot complain. Only other drawback for the room is that you can't tell what kind of weather to prepare for (i.e. rain, sun etc.).
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Location,

likes.disliked: — Starting to show age in some of the fixtures

reviews.text: The only drawback with the room is that the hotel is starting to show its age with some of the fixtures. I noticed plug-ins/receptacles were starting to come loose and one of the telephone jacks was broken. These are minor issues and are the only real area of criticism. Rooms, common areas and facilities are all very clean.
reviews.title: Fabbie Fullerton

likes.liked: — Attention to detail, comfort and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of amenities, room service and restaurants are all very good. The pool is really nice, with an impressive view day or night. Its a full 25 meters and is open at 6.00 AM until 11 PM. I went almost every day before sunrise and often had only one other person in the pool. The spa is also very nice, although quite expensive, but again the atmosphere and professionalism are top notch.
reviews.title: Top Corner of the Fullerton!

likes.disliked: — Only a single sink in the bathroom, and no biget.

reviews.text: Overall a great location, (quiet area, but only 4 stops away from Orchard Road Station, so its good for business and shopping), great staff and good food. It is by no means cheap, but seems to provide pretty good value for the money.
reviews.title: Quite Superb

likes.disliked: — Its big so you lose a little personal attention

reviews.text: Firstly, I was disappointed by my room. A large number of rooms go to the inside court ie no proper daylight. I asked to be given a room with daylight (not necessarily bay view). After a lot of checking, I was offered a room abt $75 higher then my corporate rate. I told them I like a room at my corp rate where I can see the sky and was then given a room with city view. Unfortunately, it was right next to an office block and as the Fullerton is not very high I needed to keep my curtains closed at all time to avoid the feeling that somebody looked straight into my room. I guess I should have settled for the court view as the result was the same, drawn curtains and no sky.
reviews.title: Ordinary.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is by far the best hotel i have ever stayed in!
reviews.title: Excellent 5stars hotel! A truly luxurious and elegant hotel.

reviews.text: I and my boyfriend booked one nite under the Valentine Day promotion. At check in, we were personally walked to our room by one of the reception staff. There is a bouquet of flowers already waiting for me in the room! We were given the Quay room which overlooked the Merlion and Singapore Flyer. At night when the different colour night lighting comes on, the scenery is breathtaking. My boyfriend and I spent a good deal of time at the balcony chating while admiring the scenery...
reviews.title: The Reviews Here Are Well Deserved!

reviews.text: The room is beautiful with a very spacious bathroom. The bathtub can easily fits two person..We were given a selection of bubble bath scent to choose from and tealights. There is a wide flat sreen tv, DVD player and a bedside remote control operating the lights, curtains, clock & alarm

description: Transformed from the Fullerton Building which was built in 1928, this luxury hotel features 400 elegant rooms and suites with views of the sunlit atrium, city, river or sea. Just 25 minutes from the airport, The Fullerton is located in the financial and arts districts, minutes from the city's main shopping belt. The hotel features award-winning restaurants, the stylish Post Bar, an outdoor infinity pool, a 24-hour fitness centre and a luxury spa.
